hadithText:
The Verse: 'Neither say your prayer aloud, nor say it in a low tone.' (17.110) was revealed as regards 
invocation.
The family of Muhammad did not eat two meals on one day, but one of the two was of dates.
The bed mattress of the Prophet was made of a leather case stuffed with palm fibres.
The most beloved action to Allah's Apostle was that whose doer did it continuously and regularly.
The Prophet said, "Do not abuse the dead, for they have reached the result of what they have done."

The Prophet said, "Our (Apostles') property should not be inherited, and whatever we leave, is to be 
spent in charity."

The Prophet said, "The hand should be cut off for stealing something that is worth a quarter of a Dinar 
or more."
The Prophet said, "The hand of a thief should be cut off for stealing a quarter of a Dinar."
The Prophet said, "The hand should be cut off for stealing a quarter of a Dinar."
I heard Allah's Apostle in his prayer, seeking refuge with Allah from the afflictions of Ad-Dajjal.
Allah's Apostle said, "The most hated person in the sight of Allah, is the most quarrelsome person."
The Prophet said, "The most hated man in the Sight of Allah is the one who is the most quarrelsome."
The Prophet (saws) said, "If a woman gives in charity from her husband's house ..." (See next hadith)

The Prophet and I used to take a 
bath from one container (of water).
"When the Prophet would exit the toilet he would say: 'Ghufranak.'"
hadithNarrated: 'Aishah, [may Allah be pleased with her] said:

hadithText: "Allah's Messenger had a cloth that he would use to dry off with after Wudu."
she washed Mani from the garment of Allah's Messenger.
hadithNarrated: Sulaiman bin Yasar narrated from Aishah, that :

hadithText: "Allah's Messenger would sleep while he was Junub, and without touching water (performing Ghusl)."
Allah's Messenger said: "The Salat of a women who has reached the age of menstruation is not accepted without a Khimar"
Allah's Messenger (S) said: "The two Rak'ah of Fajr are better than the world and what is in it."
"The Prophet ordered the construction of Masajid in all Dur and that they be kept clean and scented."
"The Messenger of Allah would fast Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays in one months, and Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays in the next month."
The Messenger of Allah said: "Whoever stays with a people, then he is not to fast without their permission."
The Messenger of Allah said: "Al-Fitr is the day that the people break the fast, and Al-Adha is the day that the people sacrifice."
"I twisted the garlands for all of the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah, which were sheep, then he did not assume Ihram."
"The Messenger of Allah only camped at Al-Abtah because it was easier for his departure."
"I was not envious of anyone whose death was easy after I saw the severity the death of the Messenger of Allah."
"The Messenger of Allah performed Salat over Suhail bin Al-Baida in the Masjid."
The Messenger of Allah said: "Publicize this marriage, and hold it in the Masjid, and beat the Duff for it."
"The Messenger of Allah married me in Shawwal, and he took up residence with me in Shawwal."
"The Messenger of Allah gave us the choice, so we chose him. So was that a divorce?"
“Barfah’s husband was a free man, so the Messenger of Allah let her choose.”
"The Prophet would accept gifts and he would give something in return."
"The maternal uncle inherits from the one who has no heirs."
hadithNarrated: Aishah narrated that the Messenger of Allah(S.A.W) said:

hadithText: "I have not seen ailment effecting anyone worse than upon the Messenger of Allah (s.a.w)."
"We, the family of Muhammad, would go for a month without kindling  a fire, having only water and dates."
That the Messenger of Allah (saws) said: "There is no vowing for disobedience, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."
That the Prophet (saws) said: "There is no vowing in disobedience to Allah, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."
The Messenger of Allah (saws) said: “Whoever supplicates against the one who wronged him has triumphed.”

that a group of Jews entered upon the Prophet (SAW) and they said: "As-Samu 'Alaik (death be upon you)." So the Prophet (SAW) said: "Wa 'Alaik (And upon you)." So 'Aishah said: "I said: '[Rather] upon you be death and the curse.'" So the Prophet (SAW) said: "O 'Aishah! Indeed Allah loves gentleness in every matter." 'Aishah said: "Did you not hear what they said?" He said: "And I replied: 'And upon you.'"
"The Messenger of Allah (SAW) went out during the morning wearing a Mirt made of black hair."
that the Prophet (SAW) would recite: "Furuhun Wa Raihanun Wa Jannatu Na'im (56:89)"
"The Prophet (SAW) would not sleep until he recited Surat Bani Isra'il and Az-Zumar."
"The Prophet (SAW) died when he was sixty-three years old."
hadithNarrated: Narrated 'Aishah [may Allah be pleased with her]:

hadithText: that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "It is not befitting that a group, among whom is Abu Bakr, be led by other than him."
"I have not seen anyone clearer (in speech) than 'Aishah."
"She is his wife in the world and in the Hereafter." - meaning: 'Aishah [may Allah be pleased with her].
that the Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: "The most hated man to Allah is the most quarrelsome."
The Messenger of Allah (SAW) recited Surat Al-A'raf in maghrib and split it between two rak'ahs.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: "Aishah said: 'Turning around during prayer is something that the Shaitan snatches from one's prayer.'"
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Abu 'Atiyyah said:

hadithText: "I saw the Prophet (SAW) praying while sitting cross-legged."
The Messenger of Allah (SAW) used to pray witr with nine and pray two rak'ahs sitting down.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah (SAW) used to pray nine rak'ahs at night."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: The Prophet (SAW) would not omit four rak'ahs before Zuhr and two rak'ahs before Fajr.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: The Prophet (SAW) said: "The two rak'ahs (before) Fajr are better than this world and everything in it."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that :

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah (SAW) used to pray two brief rak'ahs between the Adhan and Iqamah for Fajr prayer.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that:

hadithText: The Messenger of Allah (SAW) said: and he mentioned something similar.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Sa'eed bin Jubair, from Aishah, that:

hadithText: "We used to garland the sheep, then the Messenger of Allah would send it, and he would not enter a state of Ihram."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I used to twist the garlands for the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah. Then he would not avoid anything that the Muhrim avoids."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: That on one occasion the Messenger of Allah sent sheep as a Hadi and garlanded them.
"I sued to twist the garlands of the sacrificial sheep of the Messenger of Allah. Then he did not enter a state of Ihram."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I used to twist the garlands of sacrificial sheep of the Messenger of Allah. Then he did not enter a state of Ihram."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I used to twist the garlands for the sacrificial sheep of the Messenger of Allah."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "I remember twisting the garlands for the sheep, the Hadi of the Messenger of Allah, then he stayed as a non-Muhrim."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: 'I saw the glistening of the perfume in the parting of the Messenger of Allah after three (days).
'I used to see the glistening of the perfume in the parting of the Messenger of Allah after three (days)
"I saw the glistening of the perfume on the head of the Messenger of Allah while he was initiating Ihram.
"It is as if I can see the glistening of the perfume in parting of the Messenger of Allah while he was in Ihram. (sahih)
"It is as if I can see the glistening of the perfume in the parting on the head of the Messenger of Allah when he was in Ihram.(Shah)
" I used to see the glistening of the perfume at the roots of the hair of the Messenger of Allah when he was in Ihram.(sahih)
"The glistening of the perfume could be seen in the parting (of the hair) of the Messenger of Allah while he was in Ihram.''
"It is as if I can see the glistening of the perfume on the head of the Messenger of Allah while he is in Ihram.
"The Messenger of Allah used to be keen to fast on Mondays and Thursday."
hadithNarrated: It was narrate from Jubair bin Nufair that 'Aishah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah used to fast (all of) Shaban except a little."
"The Messenger of Allah used to fast all of Shaban."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Jubair bin Nufair that 'Aishah said:

hadithText: "The month which the Messenger of Allah most liked to fast was Shaban; indeed he used to join it to Ramadan."
"There is no fast except for one who intends to fast before dawn." (Daif)
hadithNarrated: Something similar was narrated from 'Aishah and Hafsah:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah used to fast Sha`ban and Ramadan, and he made sure to fast on Mondays and Thursday."
"May Allah curse people who take the graves of their prophets as Masjids."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'Do not verbally abuse the dead, for they have reached the consequences of what they did."'
that Abu Bakr kissed the Prophet when he had died.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Ibn 'Abbas and Aishah:

hadithText: that Abu Bakr kissed the Prophet between the eyes when he had died.
"The Prophet allowed Sawdah to leave Jam (Al-Muzdalifah) before dawn because she was a heavyset woman.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated that Aishah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah said: 'Suckling once or twice does not make (marriage) prohibited.'"
"The superiority of 'Aishah to other women is like the superiority of Tharid to other kinds of food."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Abu Musa that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "I noticed that he was not there one night" and he quoted the rest of the Hadith.
"The Messenger of Allah gave us the choice and we chose him; was that a divorce?"
"The Prophet gave his wives the choice and that was not a divorce."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from Masruq that 'Aishah said:

hadithText: "The Messenger of Allah gave us the choice and we chose him, and that was not counted as anything."
"The Prophet was asked about the hides of dead animals." He said: "Tanning it purifies it."
"The Messenger of Allah was asked about the hides of dead animals." He said: "Tanning it purifies it."
the Messenger of Allah cut off (a thief's hand) for one quarter of a Dinar.
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah, may Allah be pleased with her, that:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for a quarter of a Dinar, or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Prophet said:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah that the Messenger of Allah said:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah, from the Prophet:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Aishah, from the Prophet:

hadithText: "The hand of the thief is to be cut off for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Amrah that she heard 'Aishah say:

hadithText: "Cutting off (the hand of the thief) is for one-quarter of a Dinar or more."
hadithNarrated: It was narrated from 'Amrah that 'Aishah said:
